intro: Hygrophila pubescens var. atricheta, commonly known as the velvet hygrophila, is a species of flowering plant in the Acanthaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage, which gives it its common name. It thrives in wet or semi-aquatic environments, often found in slow-moving freshwater habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for aquariums and water gardens.
